contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox lake | lake_name = Virmajärvi | image_lake = Easternmost finland.jpg | caption_lake = Easternmost point of Finland, photo made by Russian member of bilateral re-demarcation of a boundary commition | image_bathymetry = | caption_bathymetry = | location = | coords = {{Coord|62|54|31|N|31|35|11|E|region:FI_type:waterbody|display=inline,title}} | type = | inflow = | outflow = | catchment = | basin_countries = Finland, Russia | length = 1 km | width = | area = | depth = | max-depth = | volume = | residence_time = | shore = | elevation = | islands = | cities = | frozen = }} '''Virmajärvi''' is a small ({{Convert|1|km|1|adj=on}} long) [[lake]] straddling the border between [[Finland]] ([[Ilomantsi]] [[Municipalities of Finland|municipality]]) and Russia ([[Suoyarvsky District]], [[Republic of Karelia]]). It is located {{Convert|19|km|abbr=on}} east of the village of [[Hattuvaara]]. The [[Extreme points of Finland|easternmost point of Finland]] and of the [[Extreme points of the European Union|continental European Union]] is located on an island in the Virmajärvi. {{DEFAULTSORT:Virmajarvi}} [[Category:Ilomantsi]] [[Category:Lakes of Finland]] [[Category:Lakes of the Republic of Karelia]] [[Category:Neva basin]] [[Category:Finland–Russia border]] [[Category:International lakes of Europe]] [[Category:Geography of North Karelia]] {{EasternFinland-geo-stub}} {{RepublicofKarelia-geo-stub}}
